3: Opening her eyes after the brief memory, Alpha clenches her left fist.
How many of my memories did you see in my M.I.N.D., Lucia?
The mission from Ascnet, or the pitiful wish of those wishing to ascend, but reaching a dead end? Or could it even be those despicable traps by the humans?
But more than likely, she had only caught a few scattered fragments in a hurry.
Besides that incident, which Lucia will surely recall, Alpha has other countless memories of nights when she was fed up with the senseless sacrifices.
...But the killing did not stop at the living. Even the memories for those that have passed on, the hints of warmth they left behind, were brutally destroyed.
That is the only thing she cannot forgive.
That was when it started, wasn't it?
Suddenly, Alpha hears a noise in her head. She shakes her head.
You were gradually robbed of everything you had and ended up with nothing.
But it was because of this that the Ascendants began their subsequent operations.
—Heading to Kowloong to steal Huaxu was to topple the main culprit hiding in Eden's shadow.
Although they each had their own reason for doing so...
The crackling noise echoes in her hearing module.
As Luna said, the noise serves as a catalyst, constantly stirring up thoughts buried deep in the M.I.N.D. and amplifying ill will.
Alpha knows that strong emotions are the basis of an Ascendant. Only with them can one obtain the energy of the Ascension-Network.
Be the newest agent and gain the strength to keep advancing.
I don't need it.
Alpha is not fully sure why she received the invitation from the Ascension-Network.
It could be due to a factor she possesses, or a combination of conditions, but whatever it is, it does not matter to her.
Because she will reject it anyway.
You don't have anything left, no family, no comrades... How will you take on so many enemies by yourself? How will you save Luna?

Alpha does not respond. She ignores the agitating noise and makes for an area she has not searched. Even if it were swarming with enemies and there was not much hope, she would still continuing searching.
Suddenly, a transport craft with the Babylonia insignia lands a distance away. The hatch opens and a person walks out.
Such concentration of the Punishing Virus... An Ascendant? No... he isn't connected to Ascnet. Why did he come here alone?
Once the transport craft departs, Alpha follows him, suspicious. She sees him approaching his comrades.
Are they here for the remnants of the Red Tide or to search for Luna?
She dodged into the ruins to the side in order to continue observing the four.
Who was that?
Huh?
Was someone running behind us?
Camu looks back, but the barren land is devoid of life.
Let's go check it out.
That figure ran off to the west, right in the direction of our target.
We also need to check for any signs of the Red Tide. Leave it to me.
The terrain here is too difficult to differentiate, Camu. We can split up after we reach our target.
Okay.
That's not the Gray Ravens...
From the shadows, Alpha watches the four from a distance and sees them holding a detector. It seems they are looking for something in this barren land.
...They've found the remnants of the Red Tide below.
The sewers below used to be abandoned before they were taken over by the Red Tide.
There was a simple reason for their abandonment—underground city 075 was spread out and the sewers fell into disrepair a long time ago, resulting in collapses every now and then.
Many places like this, where people do not usually visit, exist in underground city 075.
But to find Luna, Alpha has decided to search every nook and cranny.
When Longinus descends, Alpha has just concluded her investigation of the surface. With her newly obtained clues, she returns underground to recommence her search.
A violent shaking comes from the surface, and the intense heat can even be felt from the walls below.
Although Alpha, who is trailing the Task Force, has anticipated what will happen, she cannot help grimacing when the tremors and searing heat hit.
Just as she plans to continue trailing them, she hears the sound of waves in the distance.
Looks like the humans didn't manage to completely get rid of the Red Tide.
She listens carefully for the direction of the gushing red tide, and realizes that it only lasted a moment before being drowned out by the shaking earth.
The amount of Red Tide has decreased and it's coming from...
Figuring out that the sound is coming from unknown areas, Alpha quickly chases after it.
Just as she is about to arrive at the spot, she finds the way forward blocked by a thick stone wall.
Oh? Does it interest you?
I've told you before that the only thing behind this wall is the abandoned sewers that might collapse at any moment, no different from an agent who has lost their strength.
Ignoring the noise in her M.I.N.D., Alpha conducts a quick search and finds a control panel to a secret door in the corner.
This area was recently submerged by the Red Tide and shouldn't have been discovered by the humans.
After repeated searching, Alpha finds a small control panel to the secret door in the corner.
It's hard to believe something like this is hidden down here.
If the Red Tide has escaped to this place, it is likely that the agent and Gabriel are also here.
Who knows? Perhaps there might also be Ascendants under his command.
No matter how strong you are, you have no chance at taking on so many opponents at once.
If Vonnegut and Gabriel are in there, Luna might be there too.
Besides, unless there's a definite chance of victory, I'll avoid any battles with them.
The clamoring noise falls silent once more. Alpha pushes open the narrow secret door without hesitation and squeezes sideways into the sewers.
The red tide pools together on the uneven ground, and is now a watery liquid, a far cry from its previously viscous state. Even so, there is enough here to reach Alpha's ankles.
As I thought.
Alpha continues her exploration in silence, and she is soon met by Hetero-Creatures she has never seen.
Are these...
Gabriel's creations?
Do you know Mr. Gabriel?
A young girl she has never seen appears in the shadows, asking Alpha with a soft voice.
Her breathing is weak and she is one with the Hetero-Creature around her. Alpha has not even sensed her presence.
Is he here?
Yes, it seems you're the person he mentioned.
The girl does not seem to hold any ill will toward her.
Who are you?
I'm Mr. Vonnegut's subordinate. My name is Cinderelik.
What an unsurprising answer. Alpha walks toward the girl in the shadows to see her face more clearly.
Do you wish to destroy this place?
No, I have no interest in senseless destruction.
Thank you.
She gave a slight bow to Alpha in greeting.
But we can't let the humans learn of this place yet.
I trust you. You're an Ascendant. I won't stand in your way.
But when you leave, I'll seal the exit.
This is the task Mr. Vonnegut has given me. I'm not to leave any entrances or exits open unless there are extraordinary circumstances. I beg your understanding.
...As you wish.
If you're here, does that mean the agent is here too?
No, Mr. Vonnegut only comes here when necessary.
Alpha appraises the girl in front of her, trying to figure out from her expression if she is lying.
But the girl's face remains unchanging and she could well be an answering machine. She does not reveal any additional information.
However, there seems to be an ember of insanity burning in the depths of her amber eyes, but it is hidden by a veneer of politeness, making it difficult to see.
Based on her experience, Alpha sees that there are similarities between this girl and Gabriel, but within this similarity are some essential differences.
What do you do here?
Study.
Cinderelik is not lying. Neither has she changed the topic. Rather, she has chosen to tell a half-truth.
(Looks like she's the more troublesome type.)
She does not ask any more questions. She passes Cinderelik, preparing to head into the darkness.
Where are you going?
To find someone.
There are some places you cannot go.
And if I insist?
Cinderelik looks at Alpha without responding, but the answer has been made clear in the silence.
The goal now is to look for Luna. It is better to avoid unnecessary battles and find clues from places she can go.
But judging by her observation of Cinderelik's abilities, she would not have been a tough opponent.
(How about forcing her way through and continuing to investigate the forbidden area?)
Just as she was contemplating this, a figure leisurely sauntered over.
Vonnegut?
It's her.
The noise recognizes the figure and speaks calmly, as if the approaching figure were insignificant.
Alpha turns around to see a female slowly turning the corner. She keeps looking around her.
Hello.
She sees Alpha in front of her and cheerfully greets her. In her hand is an unidentifiable iris.
Although Alpha does not sense any danger coming from her, she is still wary of the stranger.
I was careless and got lost. Do you know where the exit is?
Who are you? What are you doing here?
I was curious... And suddenly saw a narrow secret door over there.
Seeing that Alpha does not respond, she turns to look curiously at Cinderelik standing in the corner.
Did I interrupt your conversation?
Seeing that Alpha does not respond, she tilts her head to look at Cinderelik standing in the corner.
The mundanity and normalcy of the words have left Alpha unable to answer. She glances at Cinderelik, who also does not seem to understand what is going on.
Looks like you're not one of Vonnegut's Ascendants.
That's right. I'm like him, an agent called here by the glad tidings.
But it seems he's taken care of everything here. There's nothing that requires my help.
An agent... What is your name?
Name? That's not an important piece of information.
She lowers her eyes and tucks the loose strands of hair behind her ears with her delicate fingers, smiling innocently.
People have given me many names, but the most common one is... 'The Merciful One'.
If you require a name to call me by, you may call me that.
If neither of you know where the exit is, I'll continue with my search. I apologize for interrupting your conversation.
She waves at the two while holding the iris and saunters off.
(There is another agent here, so if I attack Cinderelik, it may attract her attention. I have greater priorities, so it's better to be cautious.)
Alpha does not stay any longer. She turns around and disappears down the sewers without looking back.
Alpha looks up from the flashback to see the squad having fun in the distance.
...How carefree of them.
Absentmindedly, she recalls the memory fragments she saw in the M.I.N.D., memories from the other 'her.'
Constructs have the commandant's full respect, and the Gray Ravens are no longer just weapons for battle. In fact, there is even a sense of camaraderie between them.
If humans had aspired to peace and compassion like the Gray Ravens and the squad before her, perhaps this catastrophe would not have happened in the first place.
But those are purely hypothetical ideals. In reality, the Constructs are stuck in a quagmire and are forced to swallow the mud they are choking on.
For before they could even consider issues like equality and oppression, they had to first survive.
Those who pass the filtering understand that should a day come when the Punishing Virus is no longer a threat, the only beings left in this world will be Constructs.
But the humans who are still flesh and blood, with their deep-seated prejudice, aren't even able to pass the preliminary filtering process by the Punishing Virus.
That's why no one has ever mentioned one of the sources of human evil — arrogance.
Alpha tightens her grip on her katana's hilt and tries to shut off the cacophony of noises that emerges successively in her M.I.N.D.
Suddenly, Chrome receives an anonymous encrypted message on his terminal.
'Any news on Luna?'
Who'd send a message like that?
Chrome exams the meta-data for any possible clues, but it has been scrubbed clean.
There's no way to trace the sender. Our top priority is to find the Red Tide. There's no time to waste.
We may not be able to trace it, but I'm sure you have a pretty good idea who sent it.
Chrome furrows his eyebrows thinking about the current state of 【kuroname】.
Although he has speculated that it might be someone who is looking for Luna, it would be foolish to probe for information this way.
I think it's someone who is worried about Gray Raven.
Gray Raven?
Alpha furrows her brows when she hears that name.
Are you worried about them?
They're fairly perfect 'candidates' for Ascnet.
Even though they've foiled your plans so many times?
I've stood in their way loads of times too.
There is no need for resentment when opposing sides are in conflict, because they aren't set in stone.
Gray Raven? What happened to them?
I heard something from my father before we left.
【kuroname】... not only violated military orders, but is also facing accusations of harboring an Ascendant.
Harboring an Ascendant? How's that possible?
Looks like that commandant is quite similar to a certain somebody, unable to resist the temptation of power.
Choosing to connect to an agent is a death sentence.

You seem to have forgotten that 【kuroname】 was even able to withstand the corruption in Huaxu's M.I.N.D. Of course the commandant would be able to withstand the issues that come with connecting to an agent.
Does that mean... the commandant's 'confined treatment' is just an excuse?
You know about that?
No wonder you haven't gotten much sleep recently.
I just wanted to help treat 【kuroname】. After all, I still owe the commandant.
But it didn't take me long to realize it wasn't that simple.
Gray Raven still doesn't know the whole story.
If they did, they would rather have their memories checked than let 【kuroname】 be charged.
Therein lies the problem.
Lucia, being closest to 【kuroname】 then, also lost consciousness toward the end. So there isn't any proof to exonerate 【kuroname】.
Unless someone can find the target's whereabouts, they're going to be monitored indefinitely and prohibited from performing missions.
Besides 【kuroname】, who else would know about Luna's whereabouts?
At least this means Luna isn't in Babylonia.
That reminds me. Hassen looked like he had something weighing on his mind this morning.
...There have been some other oddities as well.
Seeing that Kamui wants to question Wanshi, Chrome sticks out his hand to end the conversation.
This is not the place for chit-chat.
Our top priority is the mission. Save it for when we're back in Babylonia.
Roger.
Gray Raven...
So that's why they weren't on this mission.
If 【kuroname】 knows what happened to Luna, Babylonia is using 'monitoring' as a cover to protect the commandant.
If not..
Are you choosing to trust humans?
Alpha was silent for a moment.
I just don't want to ignore a possibility.
If 【kuroname】 really doesn't know what happened to Luna and this was planned by the humans...
A commandant who can connect to agents will only endanger Ascendants and agents.
As long as 【kuroname】, 'Lucia' and the Gray Ravens are loyal to Babylonia, Luna won't be safe from their future plans.
But when you questioned 'Lucia' in the M.I.N.D., didn't you hold on to a faint hope that she could provide another possible path for Luna?
Hope... Heh, those words were just a reminder not to be so naive.
Whether or not she's ever thought about this is not an issue. She will never allow Luna to co-exist.
But you believe she will save Luna.
Because I know myself, and I'd never stand on the sidelines even if I didn't remember Luna.
At the very least, I'd try to make contact once.
Besides, Gray Raven's mission was to destroy the Polyphage. If they hadn't pulled Luna out, they wouldn't have been able to complete their mission.
The Strike Hawk squad started talking again and the noise fell silent once more.
...Looks like those carefree fellas have found the right passage.
You want to help them?
There are places in the sewers I've never been to. I could wait for them to draw Cinderelik and Vonnegut's attention and sneak in.
Besides...
If they return alive, Babylonia will know what's happening here.
Babylonia will then turn their attention to him, making it more convenient for me to take action.
Alpha dashes into the pervasive smoke, and her last sentence is lost in the wind.
'...Lucia, no matter what choice 【kuroname】 makes or what the commandant has to face, you'll be pushed and shoved until you're standing on the 'starting point'.'
